name: Whole Wheat Pizza Dough Secret Family Recipe
description: This recipe makes one large pizza crust. Top crust with your favorite toppings and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups hard white whole wheat flour, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Stir yeast and sugar into warm water in a large bowl; set aside until liquid starts to bubble and foam, 5 to 10 minutes. Mix in oil. Add flour and salt, stirring until dough is smooth; stir in more flour as needed.

Knead dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes and place in a large bowl; cover bowl with a damp towel. Allow dough to rise for 20 to 30 minutes. Place dough on a pizza stone and roll out with a rolling pin.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Whole Wheat Pizza Dough Secret Family Recipe

review.reviewBody: Works out awesome. Now my only pizza dough recipe! I layer the ingredients in my breadmaker on dough setting. Water, oil, sugar, salt, then flour and then yeast.
Really nice and crispy crust, Also used my bread machine to make - dough cycle, Just perfect. Topped with tomato sauce and cheese and pepperoni and baked at 425 for 20 mins.

I made this crust on Thanksgiving eve, because I didn't have enough to do with making 2 pie crusts, baking 2 pies and prepping things for a salad!  Oh yes, back to the crust......we really enjoyed this crust.  I didn't know what 'hard white whole wheat flour' was, so I used 1 cup bread flour, 1 cup AP flour and 1 cup brown whole wheat flour.  I proofed the yeast and sugar before adding all ingredients to the bread machine.  I let the dough rise in a bowl 30 minutes after taking it out of the bread machine.  This dough was extremely easy to work with and I definitely would use this recipe again.  I'm going to try another store or 2 to try and find the correct flour. I pre-baked the crust for 5 minutes before adding the toppings.  Pizza and crust were delicious!  Thanks Miriam for sharing your recipes, I look forward to trying your other published ones.

Easy-to-follow instructions, basic ingredients, and fast prep!  The key is to roll the center thin, pushing the extra dough towards the edges for a thick & chewy crust.   Much healthier and tastier than store-bought frozen pizzas.
Will try again with half white half wheat flour. It was too dense and thick. Next time I'll try to roll it as thin as possible as the thickness if the dough almost doubled in height when cooked.

This made two pizzas for us when rolled out thin. Baked at 425 for 12 minutes. It might have needed a little longer but the cheese was already getting very browned. Not exceptional but held a lot of toppings well and was not too dense.

Loved this recipe! There was way too much dough for my liking (I like a really thin crust) so I split it between two pizza stones and invited the neighbors over to eat the second pizza. Next time I will likely just split the recipe in half. After rolling out the dough to about 1/8-1/4 inch thick I melted some butter and cut up fresh rosemary and brushed it over the top of the pizza dough. I put some shredded bbq chicken (wish I could say it was homemade but it was actually the Jack Daniels bbq chicken from Costco) onion and fresh mozzarella cheese over the dough and put it in the oven at 400 degrees for about 11-13 minutes. My husband isn't usually a fan of things with whole wheat but he loved it and this recipe made it to his "make this dinner again" list.

I don't have hard white whole wheat flour and didn't know what it was so I looked it up. According to Bob's Red Mill it is flour ground from whole grain hard white wheat berries. And now we know! No clue if I can get it at my local grocery store but I'll check the next time I'm in that aisle. Since I don't have the flour I used half whole wheat flour and half white for this and it turned out well. I baked at 425 for about 25-30 minutes with toppings and hubs and I enjoyed it for dinner. thanks for the recipe!

This is a good recipe if you like a purely whole wheat dough. Because of this it is quite dense but it is good. If you like a slightly lighter dough substitute some regular bread flour. Also I made this in my bread machine for 10 servings and needed to add 2 Tbsp morer water to what the automatic conversion function on the site calculated. Finally using a flavor infused olive oil adds an interesting touch.
